# FAQ
# 
What is Birdeye?
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/faq#what-is-birdeye)
Birdeye represents a Blockchain Data Aggregator tailored for Traders. Our core objective is to assist traders in their investment deliberations through the provisioning of data-centric market analysis tools sourced from Birdeye and its affiliated partners.
# 
What is the scope of Birdeye's functions?
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/faq#what-is-the-scope-of-birdeyes-functions)
Birdeye undertakes the collection and presentation of data concerning diverse blockchain projects, thereby empowering traders with insights for making well-informed decisions. Our platform encompasses a range of sophisticated functionalities designed to cater to traders, including but not limited to:
 * Token Information: Access to comprehensive details regarding a variety of tokens.
 * Trader Profiles: Gaining insights into trading activities and the performance of market traders.
 * Discovery of Promising Tokens: Employing diverse filters for the facile identification of tokens with promising potential.
 * Transaction Tracking: The ability to monitor all blockchain transactions to remain up-to-date with investment-related choices.
 * PriceBot:
 * Discord Bot: Real-time access to price, volume, liquidity, and holder information for tokens on Solana and EVM Chains directly within your Discord server.
 * Telegram Bot: Integration of the bot into your Telegram group, enabling real-time price updates for the group token. The feature also extends to setting price alerts for notifications upon reaching specified targets.
 * Telegram New Pairs Bot: Staying informed about new pair listings across supported exchanges through Telegram notifications, offering a competitive edge in identifying fresh opportunities in the market.
 * API, Web sockets, and iframes: Access to an array of integrations and tools to elevate your trading experience.

# 
Does Birdeye possess its proprietary token?
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/faq#does-birdeye-possess-its-proprietary-token)
No, Birdeye does not maintain its own dedicated token.
# 
From where does Birdeye source its data?
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/faq#from-where-does-birdeye-source-its-data)
Birdeye acquires data from a diverse array of origins, encompassing blockchain networks and exchanges, thereby enabling the delivery of comprehensive insights.
# 
Across which platforms is Birdeye accessible?
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/faq#across-which-platforms-is-birdeye-accessible)
Birdeye is compatible with both desktop and mobile devices, ensuring seamless accessibility for users seeking to leverage its capabilities.
# 
What is the procedure for a project to achieve verification status on Birdeye?
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/faq#what-is-the-procedure-for-a-project-to-achieve-verification-status-on-birdeye)
Verification of projects on Birdeye is administered by our partner, Jupiter. Birdeye is not directly involved in the project verification process.
# 
How can a project update its social media information on Birdeye?
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/faq#how-can-a-project-update-its-social-media-information-on-birdeye)
To update a project's social media information on Birdeye, you can readily make use of this dedicated form provided for the purpose.

# Privacy Policy
INTRODUCTION
We, at Wings Lab Pte. Ltd. ("we," "us," or "our"), recognize the importance our users attach to the handling of their Personal Data (as defined below). This Privacy Policy outlines our data processing practices when visitors and users access our websites and services. We kindly urge you to carefully review this Privacy Policy. Should you have any inquiries, please feel free to reach out to us as specified in this Privacy Policy.
This Privacy Policy serves as a supplementary document and does not replace any prior consents you may have granted us regarding your Personal Data. Any consents provided in connection with this Privacy Policy add to any rights we hold under applicable law for the handling or processing of your Personal Data.
We retain the right to modify this Privacy Policy periodically. While you should regularly review this Privacy Policy to be informed of any revisions, we may also communicate updates via various means, including notices or alternative forms of communication, as deemed suitable, or as mandated by applicable law.
ACCEPTANCE OF THIS PRIVACY POLICY
By engaging with us, submitting information to us, or enrolling in any of our products or services on our websites, you acknowledge and consent to our processing of your Personal Data. Such processing may be carried out by our authorized service providers, adhering to the manner and purposes outlined in this Privacy Policy.
Should you disagree with any aspect of this Privacy Policy or find it discomforting, we advise you to cease access or use of our websites and services immediately.
COLLECTION OF PERSONAL DATA
 1. "Personal Data" pertains to (a) data concerning an identified or identifiable natural person; or (b) data analogous to ‚Äúpersonal data,‚Äù ‚Äúpersonal information,‚Äù ‚Äúpersonally identifiable information,‚Äù or related terms as defined in relevant data protection laws.
 2. The scope and kinds of Personal Data we gather and process hinge on the nature of your interactions with us. In general, the following categories are collected and processed:
 1. Account and profile information, including email addresses, passwords, and/or blockchain wallet addresses;
 2. Payment and transaction information, comprising credit/debit cardholder names, credit/debit card numbers, country, city, state, address, and/or blockchain wallet transactions. We might involve third-party vendors for payment information collection and processing;
 3. Contact information, encompassing usernames in third-party services like Telegram or Discord, first and last names, email addresses, professional titles, company names, and/or phone numbers;
 4. Technical information and usage data, such as site-related and statistical details about visitor arrivals, IP addresses potentially revealing approximate or precise locations, device information, clickstream data, time stamps, and particulars about how our websites and services are utilized. This information might be automatically recorded via server logs or cookies. Further details are provided in the Cookies section below;
 5. Marketing and communications data, involving preferences for receiving marketing communications from us, communication preferences, communication history with us, our service providers, or third parties; and/or
 6. Other information, including participation in contests, promotions, or surveys, along with photographs, videos, and/or audio recordings taken by us or our agents.
 3. We may also collect and process information from third-party sources, such as public records, social media platforms, and blockchain data related to records or transaction histories occurring on the applicable blockchain for a blockchain wallet address.
 4. Additionally, we may provide features that enable users to invite or refer friends or contacts to utilize our services. In such cases, we may collect Personal Data (e.g., contact details) about these invitees or referrals to facilitate outreach. We advise against referring individuals to us or sharing their Personal Data without proper authorization or consent.
 5. While tagging blockchain wallet addresses is intrinsic to our business, we refrain from employing user Personal Data (e.g., blockchain wallet addresses within account or profile information) to append or publish such labels or expose the identity of any natural person as the owner of a given blockchain wallet address. Furthermore, we take measures to ensure no inadvertent identification of blockchain wallet address owners occurs through our technical and organizational arrangements. Exceptions to this rule are limited, such as labeling high-profile public figures who have openly disclosed their blockchain wallet addresses. However, such exceptions account for a negligible percentage of the blockchain wallet address-associated information utilized to deliver our websites and services.

PURPOSES FOR PROCESSING YOUR PERSONAL DATA
 1. Where permitted by applicable law, we process your Personal Data for the following purposes (which may apply even if you do not maintain or have terminated your account with us):
 1. Providing products and/or services you've purchased or requested, personalizing and customizing your service experience, which may involve recommending features or content based on your usage patterns, profile information, preferences, and other submitted data;
 2. Enhancing our products, services, processes, and business. This includes using technical, usage, aggregated, de-identified, and/or anonymized data to comprehend user behavior and market trends;
 3. Communication purposes, including notifying you about service matters, account updates, addressing your queries, requests, feedback, and suggestions, or sending you direct marketing communications or interest-based advertisements, in line with our legitimate interests or applicable law;
 4. Business operations management, encompassing internal policy adherence, records maintenance for tax purposes, incident and accident reporting, protection and enforcement of contractual and legal rights, and facilitating business asset transactions;
 5. Compliance with applicable laws, regulations, rules, codes, or guidelines, and assisting law enforcement and investigations by relevant authorities;
 6. Facilitating account registration and transactions, which may involve verifying your blockchain wallet address or other methods;
 7. Linking relevant Personal Data for the listed purposes; and/or
 8. Any other purpose pertinent or reasonably necessary for the above.
 2. For specific products, services, or interactions, we might provide additional "just-in-time" disclosures or notify you specifically about other purposes for which we process your Personal Data. These notices may complement or clarify our privacy practices, offering you additional choices concerning how we process your Personal Data for those purposes.

DISCLOSURE OF PERSONAL DATA
Subject to applicable law, your Personal Data may be disclosed for the purposes mentioned above (when relevant) to entities or parties, whether located overseas or in Singapore:
 1. Vendors, agents, service providers, and other entities we engage to deliver goods and services either independently or on our behalf in connection with the purposes outlined in this Privacy Policy. Examples include payment processors, cloud service providers, analytics and search engine providers, marketing partners, and customer support;
 2. Business partners, investors, assignees, or transferees (actual or prospective) to facilitate business asset transactions, which may encompass mergers, acquisitions, debt, or asset sales;
 3. Professional advisers such as our board of directors, auditors, cybersecurity consultants, and legal representatives;
 4. Government regulators, ministries, statutory boards or authorities, and law enforcement agencies for complying with directives, laws, rules, guidelines, regulations, or requests issued by them; and/or
 5. Any other party to whom you authorize us to disclose your Personal Data.

THIRD-PARTY SITES
Our websites and services might contain links to websites or services operated by third parties. We are not accountable for the privacy practices of such third-party websites or services, even if they display our logo or trademark. # Advanced Centralized Exchange Liquidity
Welcome to the Advanced version of the Centralized Exchange Liquidity Dashboard. This enhanced tool provides deeper insights into market liquidity dynamics by aggregating data from multiple exchanges, empowering traders and analysts with comprehensive information to make informed decisions.
# 
**Table of Contents**
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/advanced-cex-liquidity#table-of-contents)
 1. Introduction
 2. Key Features
 1. Aggregated Liquidity Data
 2. Orderbook Liquidity Delta
 3. Orderbook Spread Distribution
 3. Interpreting the Data
 1. Understanding Liquidity Delta
 2. Analyzing Spread Distribution
 4. Important Considerations
 5. Conclusion

* * *
# 
1. Introduction
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/advanced-cex-liquidity#1-introduction)
Liquidity is a critical component of any financial market, reflecting the ease with which assets can be bought or sold without causing significant price movements. The Advanced Liquidity Dashboard offers enhanced analytics by aggregating data from multiple centralized exchanges and introducing two new metrics: **Orderbook Liquidity Delta** and **Orderbook Spread Distribution**. These features provide a nuanced view of market dynamics, helping users gauge the balance between buy and sell orders and understand how spreads vary over periods.
# 
2. Key Features
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/advanced-cex-liquidity#2-key-features)
## 
Aggregated Liquidity Data
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/advanced-cex-liquidity#aggregated-liquidity-data)
 * **Definition:** The dashboard aggregates liquidity data from multiple centralized exchanges, providing a comprehensive view of the market's overall liquidity landscape.
 * **Purpose:** By consolidating data from various sources, users can obtain a more accurate and holistic understanding of market conditions, minimizing the impact of anomalies or disparities present in individual exchanges.
 * **Visualization:** Aggregated data is seamlessly integrated into all liquidity metrics, ensuring that users benefit from a unified perspective across different trading platforms.

## 
Orderbook Liquidity Delta
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/advanced-cex-liquidity#orderbook-liquidity-delta)

 * **Definition:** The Liquidity Delta represents the net difference between bid and ask volumes in the aggregated orderbook. It is calculated as:

 * **Purpose:** This metric indicates the current pressure in the market‚Äîwhether buying (positive delta) or selling (negative delta) dominates.
 * **Visualization:** Displayed as a dynamic chart that updates in real-time to reflect the ongoing shifts in market sentiment across all connected exchanges.

## 
Orderbook Spread Distribution
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/advanced-cex-liquidity#orderbook-spread-distribution)

 * **Definition:** This feature analyzes the distribution of the bid-ask spread over various timeframes using aggregated data, providing insights into market volatility and liquidity consistency.
 * **Purpose:** Understanding spread distribution helps traders assess the cost of executing trades and the potential for price slippage across different exchanges.
 * **Visualization:** Presented through histograms or line charts segmented by user-defined time intervals (e.g., 1-minute, 5-minute, 15-minute), reflecting aggregated spread data.

* * *
# 
3. Interpreting the Data
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/advanced-cex-liquidity#3-interpreting-the-data)
## 
Understanding Liquidity Delta
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/advanced-cex-liquidity#understanding-liquidity-delta)
The **Orderbook Liquidity Delta** chart offers a snapshot of the market's buying and selling pressure based on aggregated data from multiple exchanges. A positive delta suggests more aggressive buying, while a negative delta indicates stronger selling activity.
**Example Interpretation:**
 * **Positive Delta:** Indicates that the cumulative bid volume across all aggregated exchanges exceeds the ask volume, potentially signaling upward price pressure.
 * **Negative Delta:** Suggests that the cumulative ask volume surpasses the bid volume across all exchanges, which may lead to downward price movement.

Important Note: While the delta provides an overview of market sentiment, it does not directly translate into trading signals due to factors like _**Market and Iceberg orders**_ that may not be fully reflected in the aggregated delta.
## 
Analyzing Spread Distribution
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/advanced-cex-liquidity#analyzing-spread-distribution)
The **Orderbook Spread Distribution** by Timeframes provides a detailed view of how the bid-ask spread behaves over different periods using aggregated data from multiple exchanges. A consistently narrow spread may indicate a highly liquid market, whereas a wide or fluctuating spread could point to volatility or lower liquidity.
**Example Interpretation:**
 * **Narrow Spread:** Lower transaction costs and higher liquidity across aggregated exchanges.
 * **Wide Spread:** Higher transaction costs and potential challenges in executing large orders without affecting the price across the market.

* * *
# 
4. Important Considerations
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/advanced-cex-liquidity#4-important-considerations)
While the **Orderbook Liquidity Delta** and aggregated data offer valuable insights into market sentiment, it's essential to understand their limitations:
 * **Current Pressure Indicator:** The delta chart reflects the present balance between buy and sell orders across aggregated exchanges but does not directly translate into trading signals.
 * **Positive Delta Caveat:** Even when the delta is positive (indicating more buy orders than sell orders), the price may not rise as expected. This discrepancy can occur due to:
 * **Market Orders:** Large market buy orders can consume available ask liquidity without necessarily leading to a sustained price increase.
 * **Iceberg Orders:** Hidden or iceberg orders, which conceal the true order size, can mask the actual supply and demand dynamics, leading to misleading delta readings.
 * **Data Aggregation Dynamics:** Aggregating data from multiple exchanges provides a broader market perspective but may also introduce complexities such as varying liquidity profiles and trading behaviors across different platforms.
 * **Dynamic Market Conditions:** Market conditions can change rapidly. It's crucial to combine delta analysis with other indicators and market intelligence for more accurate trading decisions.

# 
5. Conclusion
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/advanced-cex-liquidity#5-conclusion)
The **Advanced Centralized Exchange Liquidity** is a powerful tool designed to provide deeper insights into market liquidity and orderbook dynamics by aggregating data from multiple exchanges. By leveraging the **Orderbook Liquidity Delta** and **Orderbook Spread Distribution** , users can better understand the forces shaping price movements and optimize their trading strategies accordingly. However, always consider the inherent limitations of these metrics and use them in conjunction with a comprehensive analysis framework to enhance trading effectiveness.

# Alert - Notification Settings
# 
Birdeye Alert Notification Setup Guide
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/alert-notification-settings#birdeye-alert-notification-setup-guide)
Welcome to Birdeye! To ensure you stay on top of real-time data and market trends, follow these steps to register channels and receive alert notifications through your preferred delivery methods: Telegram, Discord, and Email.
* * *
## 
Telegram Setup
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/alert-notification-settings#telegram-setup)
Find your Telegram ID:
 * Open your Telegram app.
 * Start a chat with the "Birdeye Alert" (click here: @birdeye_alert_bot).
 * Click "Start" or type command "/start" to receive your Telegram ID and start getting notifications.
 * Save your Telegram ID in your Birdeye settings.

> ‚ùóÔ∏è
> ### 
> Important Notice
> [](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/alert-notification-settings#important-notice)
> You will NOT receive notifications if you do not click "START" on the Telegram bot
* * *
## 
Discord Setup
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/alert-notification-settings#discord-setup)
 1. Open the Discord channel you want to receive Birdeye event notifications.
 2. From the channel menu, select **Edit Channel**.
 3. Select **Integrations**.
 4. If there are no existing webhooks, select **Create Webhook**. Otherwise, select **View Webhooks** then **New Webhook**.
 5. Enter the name of the bot to post the message.
 6. Optional. Edit the avatar.
 7. Copy the URL from the **WEBHOOK URL** field.
 8. Select **Save**.

* * *
## 
Email Setup
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/alert-notification-settings#email-setup)
 * Your registered email will be input automatically to receive notifications.

# Bug Bounty Program
Welcome to the Birdeye.so Bug Bounty Program!
At Birdeye.so, we are committed to maintaining the highest standards of security for our users. We invite security researchers to help us identify vulnerabilities in our systems. In return, we offer rewards for valuable contributions that help us improve our security posture.
# 
Program Scope
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/bug-bounty-program#program-scope)
## 
In-Scope:
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/bug-bounty-program#in-scope)
 * Main website: www.birdeye.so
 * API endpoints
 * [Coming soon] Mobile apps: Birdeye for iOS and Android

## 
Out-of-Scope:
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/bug-bounty-program#out-of-scope)
 * Internal corporate network
 * Third-party applications and services
 * Non-production environments
 * Social media accounts

# 
Vulnerability Classification and Reward Structure
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/bug-bounty-program#vulnerability-classification-and-reward-structure)
We classify vulnerabilities based on their impact and severity. The following table outlines the criteria for each classification and the corresponding reward range.
Category | Conditions | Reward 
---|---|--- 
 * *Critical (CVSS 9.0-10.0)**

| 
 * Remote Code Execution (RCE)
 * SQL Injection leading to unauthorized access to sensitive data
 * Authentication bypass leading to account takeover
 * Significant data leakage of personal or sensitive information
 * Full system compromise

| $5,000+ 
 * *High 
(CVSS 7.0-8.9)**

| 
 * Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) that can lead to session hijacking or sensitive data exposure
 * Privilege escalation to administrator level
 * Security misconfigurations leading to sensitive data exposure
 * Substantial impact on application availability (e.g., persistent DoS)

| $1,000+ 
 * *Medium 
(CVSS 4.0-6.9)**

| 
 * Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) with significant impact
 * Information disclosure that exposes non-sensitive data
 * Directory traversal attacks
 * Partial bypass of security controls

| $500+ 
We don't offer monetary rewards for the Low (CVSS < 4 .0), but would love to hear your inputs if any. For those feedbacks, you can also let us know using our Feedback page: <https://feedback.birdeye.so/>
# 
Rules and Guidelines
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/bug-bounty-program#rules-and-guidelines)
 * **Eligibility** : Only test the in-scope targets. Respect user privacy and do not access or modify data without permission.
 * **Non-Disruption** : Avoid actions that could disrupt our services (e.g., DDoS attacks).
 * **Confidentiality** : Do not disclose vulnerabilities publicly until they have been fixed.
 * **Legality** : Comply with all applicable laws and do not engage in unethical behavior.

# 
Submission Process
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/bug-bounty-program#submission-process)
 * **Submit Vulnerabilities** : Send an email to dev(at)birdeye.so to submit the report.
 * **Required Information** : Include a detailed description, steps to reproduce, the potential impact, and any relevant proof of concept (PoC) code or screenshots.
 * **Acknowledgment** : We will acknowledge receipt of your submission within 24 hours.
 * **Communication** : Regular updates will be provided on the status of the report.

# 
Triage and Validation
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/bug-bounty-program#triage-and-validation)
Our internal security team will review and validate submitted vulnerabilities. The process includes:
 * **Initial Review** : Assessing the report for completeness.
 * **Reproduction** : Attempting to reproduce the vulnerability.
 * **Impact Assessment** : Determining the severity and potential impact.
 * **Reward Determination** : Deciding the appropriate reward based on the classification.

# 
Continuous Improvement
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/bug-bounty-program#continuous-improvement)
We will regularly review and update the bug bounty program based on participant feedback and changes in our systems.

# Birdeye Account
Welcome to the instructions to set up and use your Birdeye Account. This guide will walk you through the process of registering for a Birdeye account and provide an overview of how to use your account for various features on Birdeye.so, PRO membership, and accessing Birdeye data APIs.
# 
Why do you need Birdeye Account
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-account#why-do-you-need-birdeye-account)
Logging into your Birdeye account unlocks a host of benefits that make your trading and analytics experience faster, smarter, and more personalized. Here‚Äôs what you get when you sign in:
 1. **Cross-Device Syncing** 
All your preferences‚Äîchart layouts, default timeframes, indicator settings‚Äîare stored in the cloud. Switch from desktop to mobile (or vice versa) and pick up exactly where you left off.
 2. **Lighter Loading & Secure Storage**

 * Automatic Backups 
Your settings are automatically backed up. Lose or upgrade your device? Simply log in and restore your exact configuration in seconds.

 1. **Access to Premium Features:** Many advanced tools and modules require an authenticated account. By logging in, you can enable:

 * Real-Time Alerts 
Configure price, volume, or custom-indicator alerts and receive push notifications or emails the moment your conditions are met.
 * Rewards & Referrals 
Track your progress in our rewards program, earn points for activity, and redeem them for platform credits or partner perks.
 * Custom Watchlists & Labels 
Create unlimited watchlists, tag tokens or strategies with custom labels, and filter your dashboard views for faster decision-making.

# 
Register a Birdeye Account
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-account#register-a-birdeye-account)
If you don't have a Birdeye account already, you need to sign up for one. Visit the Birdeye website and navigate to the registration page. We now support web3 log in along with web2 methods.
**Getting Started**
 * Click ‚ÄúLog In‚Äù in the top-right corner of the app or website.
 * Choose your method: Wallet, Email & password, Google, or Apple Sign-In.
 * Verify your email (if using email/password) to unlock alerts and rewards.

# 
Activate your Account
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-account#activate-your-account)
Upon signing up, we will send an activation email to the email address you entered. That email contain an activation link that you need to click to activate your account. Although you can still sign in without email activation, you cannot generate API keys until your account is activated.
# 
Login to Your Account
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-account#login-to-your-account)
After successfully creating an account and verify the email, log in to your Birdeye account using your credentials.
# 
Account Usage
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-account#account-usage)
Your Birdeye account works across both platforms Birdeye.so and Birdeye Data Services. 
When you sign up at birdeye.so or bds.birdeye.so, your credentials grant you access to:
 * The main Birdeye platform for token charts, trading insights, and tools.
 * The BDS dashboard to manage API keys, monitor usage, and access real-time blockchain data.

## 
Birdeye Data Services
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-account#birdeye-data-services)
For enterprises, developers and traders, Birdeye offers powerful data APIs:
 * Real-time Market Data: Integrate real-time market data into your applications.
 * Historical Data: Retrieve historical market data for in-depth analysis.
 * Wallet Data: Access blockchain wallet data for specific chains.

## 
Birdeye.so Features
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-account#birdeyeso-features)
 * Technical Indicator on chart.
 * System Configuration: select your preferred explorers.
 * Cross-devices sync: your system setup is stored securely on our server and automatically syncs when you log in from a new device, brining uninterrupted browsing experience.

## 
PRO Membership Upgrade
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-account#pro-membership-upgrade)
Upgrading to PRO membership unlocks additional benefits:
Ad-Free Experience: Enjoy an ad-free browsing experience on Birdeye.so. 
Priority Customer Support: Get priority assistance from our support team. Exclusive Content: Access premium content and market insights.

# Batch Token CU Cost
### 
Batch CU Cost
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/batch-token-cu-cost#batch-cu-cost)
**Formula:**
> Batch CU Cost = N^0.8 √ó Base CU Cost
where:
 * **N** : Number of tokens requested in the batch.
 * **Base CU Cost** : The CU unit cost of calling a single token using multiple url (different from CU cost of single url)
 * The `Batch CU cost` is rounded up to the nearest whole number (0 decimal).

### 
Example
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/batch-token-cu-cost#example)
Given the following API costs:
API Name | Endpoint | Base CU Cost 
---|---|--- 
Token Multi Price | `/defi/multi_price` | 5 
If we request **N = 10** tokens using `/defi/multi_price`, the cost would be:
> Multi_price_batch_CU_api_cost = 5^0.8 x 10 = 38
**Note** :
 * Using the batch API is always more cost-efficient than making multiple single API calls.
 * Users should consider purchasing a Business plan to access batch APIs.
 * The larger the N, the higher the discount rate, but each API has an `n_max` cap that users should be aware of.

### 
`n_max` Table for Each API
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/batch-token-cu-cost#n_max-table-for-each-api)
API Name | Endpoint | Base CU cost | n_max (Max Tokens per Batch) 
---|---|---|--- 
Price (Multiple) GET & POST | `/defi/multi_price` | 5 | 100 
Price - Volume (Multiple) | `/defi/price_volume/multi` | 15 | 50 
Token - Meta Data (Multiple) | `/defi/v3/token/meta-data/multiple` | 5 | 50 
Token - Trade Data (Multiple) | `/defi/v3/token/trade-data/multiple` | 15 | 20 
Token - Market Data (Multiple) | `/defi/v3/token/market-data/multiple` | 15 | 20 
Pair - Overview (Multiple) | `/defi/v3/pair/overview/multiple` | 20 | 20 
All time - Trades (Multiple) | `/defi/v3/all-time/trades/multiple` | 25 | 20 
Exit liquidity (Multiple) | `/defi/v3/token/exit-liquidity/multiple` | 30 | 50 
Price stats (Multiple) | `/defi/v3/price/stats/multiple` | 20 | 20 
Token - Holder List (Batch) | `/token/v1/holder/batch` | 50 | 500 
Wallet - PnL | `/wallet/v2/pnl/multiple` | 40 | 50 
Wallet - PNL summary (multiple) | `/wallet/v2/net-worth-summary/multiple` | 50 | 100

# Birdeye Bots
Welcome to Birdeye Bots, your companions in navigating the dynamic world of crypto. These bots are designed to keep you informed, engaged, and empowered throughout your trading journey. We proudly introduce bots developed both by us and our partners:
## 
IG9 /ig'nait/ Bots (by Birdeye)
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-bots#ig9-ignait-bots-by-birdeye)
Bot Name | Platform | Link 
---|---|--- 
IG9 | Discord | Invite Link 
IG9 - Solana | Telegram | IG9 on Solana 
IG9 - EVM | Telegram | IG9 on EVM 
> üìò
> ### 
> IG9 Discord Bot's Limitation
> [](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-bots#ig9-discord-bots-limitation)
> Due to Discord's policy on servers limitation for a bot, our **IG9 on Discord** bot can only serve maximum 100 servers at once. We'll regularly and automatically review the list of servers and remove the bot from the inactive ones, so we can put the bot to where it's most useful.
## 
Bots by Birdeye's partners
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-bots#bots-by-birdeyes-partners)
Bot Name | Platform | Link | Developer 
---|---|---|--- 
Discord Price Bot | Discord | BOT No.1 - 100/100 servers used 
BOT No.2 - 100/100 servers used 
BOT No.3 - 100/100 servers used 
BOT No.4 - 100/100 servers used | Waterfall 
Telegram Price Bot | Telegram | <https://t.me/birdeyePriceBot> | Waterfall 
Telegram New Pairs bot | Telegram | <https://t.me/+DHqr9hhHxStiMGVl> | Waterfall 

* * *
# 
ü§ñ IG9 on Discord
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-bots#-ig9-on-discord)
## 
Link to the bot
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-bots#link-to-the-bot)
Check the table above
## 
What can it do?
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-bots#what-can-it-do)
Provide real time price, volume, liquidity, holder number of any tokens on Solana inside your Discord server.
## 
How to use?
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-bots#how-to-use)
 * INVITE THE BOT TO YOUR SERVER
 * You must be the OWNER of the server OR have the "Manage Server" right (ask the server Owner for that right before adding the bot).
 * Click the link above to add the bot to your server.
 * Start using the bot.

## 
COMMANDS TO CHECK PRICE
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-bots#commands-to-check-price)
 * /price [token name] (for example /price ray)
 * /price [token address]

## 
Notes
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-bots#notes)
 * The bot only shows the details of the tokens with liquidity.
 * If there are duplicate names, the bot will provide a list of duplicating options.

* * *
# 
ü§ñ IG9 on Telegram
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-bots#-ig9-on-telegram)
## 
What can it do?
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-bots#what-can-it-do-1)
 * Add the bot to Telegram group to update real time price of the group token.
 * In private mode: set price alert to receive notifications when token price get over or fall under a target. **NOTE: this feature is NOT AVAILABLE in Telegram group** - you can only use it when chat directly with the bot.

## 
How to use?
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/birdeye-bots#how-to-use-1)
**SET UP PRICE BOT IN TELEGRAM GROUP**
 * Add the bot to the group.
 * Set the role of the bot to group Admin. NOTE: the bot can‚Äôt work without Admin role.
 * Type command /setgrouptoken [token_address] to setup the bot. Only group admins can do this.
 * Any users in the group can type /price to check the token price after setting up.

# BDS ‚Äî Getting Started
## 
Log In to BDS Dashboard
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/bds-getting-started#log-in-to-bds-dashboard)
 * Use your credentials from Step 1 to Login.
 * You‚Äôll land on the BDS Dashboard‚Äîyour central hub for API key management, billing, analytics, and support.

## 
Obtain API Keys
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/bds-getting-started#obtain-api-keys)
 * Navigate to Security tab in the sidebar.
 * Click `Generate Key`, then copy your new API key.
 * Store it securely and include it in your header:

```
X-API-KEY: <your-api-key>
```

## 
Monitor Usage & Apply Restrictions
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/bds-getting-started#monitor-usage--apply-restrictions)
 * Go to Metrics to view your:
 * Compute Units (CU) consumed
 * API request counts
 * Error rates
 * From Security tab, you can:
 * Apply origin/IP restrictions
 * Regenerate or revoke keys as needed

## 
Billing & Subscription Control
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/bds-getting-started#billing--subscription-control)
 * In Packages sections, view your plan, CU pricing tiers, overage policies, and cancellation terms.
 * Upgrade or change plans instantly via the UI.
 * Read policies on:
 * Service cancellation
 * CU overages
 * CU carry‚Äëover (most plans do not allow carry‚Äëover)

## 
Generate & Use CU-Based Endpoints
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/bds-getting-started#generate--use-cu-based-endpoints)
 * Every API call uses compute units (CU) ‚Äî cost varies by endpoint.
 * Track cumulative CU via Monitoring and watch for overage alerts.

## 
Quick Setup Checklist
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/bds-getting-started#quick-setup-checklist)
 * Sign up
 * Log in: <https://bds.birdeye.so/auth/sign-in>
 * Get API Key:
 * Authentication & API Keys
 * Read API Docs
 * Documentation:
 * REST API
 * Websocket
 * Check Usage
 * Monitoring / Metrics
 * Restrict Key Access
 * Auth & API Keys ‚Üí Edit restrictions
 * Manage Billing & Plan
 * Pricing / Payment
 * Compute Unit Cost

## 
Developer Recommendations
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/bds-getting-started#developer-recommendations)
 * Key Security: Store API keys securely and rotate periodically.
 * Rate Awareness: Monitor CUs to avoid data delays or overage fees.
 * Integration Readiness: Explore WebSocket sections for streaming real-time data.
 * Access Control: Use IP/origin restrictions to secure APIs in production.

# Check-Out Policy
Effective Date: 2025-02-05
This Check-Out Policy applies to all transactions conducted Birdeye.so and bds.birdeye.so for online data 
dashboard services. By completing the check-out process, you agree to the terms and conditions outlined below.
### 
1. Confirmation Before Purchase
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/check-out-policy#1-confirmation-before-purchase)
**By completing the check-out process, you confirm that you have:**
 1. Acknowledged the Product Details:
 * Fully understood the features, functionality, and limitations of the selected subscription plan.
 * You have ensured the product meets your specific requirements and is compatible with your technical setup.
 2. Evaluated the Free Version:
 * You have used the free version provided to explore the core features and functions.
 * You are satisfied with the product‚Äôs capabilities and are proceeding with the purchase based on this understanding.
 3. Agreed to the Pricing:
 * Accepted the price of the subscription plan, including any applicable taxes or fees displayed during check-out.
 4. Accepted the Terms:
 * Read, understood, and agreed to the **No Cancellation and No Refund Policy and other applicable terms and conditions.**

### 
2. Payment Process
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/check-out-policy#2-payment-process)
**2.1. Accepted Payment Methods** 
We accept the following payment methods:
 * Credit cards (e.g., Visa, MasterCard, AMEX)
 * Debit cards
 * [Other Payment Methods, e.g., PayPal, Stripe, or cryptocurrency, if applicable]

**2.2. Payment Confirmation**
 * Payments are processed immediately upon completing the check-out process.
 * A confirmation email, including your order details, will be sent to the email address provided at check-out.

**2.3. Secure Transactions**
 * All transactions are encrypted and processed through secure payment gateways to protect customer data.

### 
3. Subscription Activation
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/check-out-policy#3-subscription-activation)
**3.1. Immediate Activation**
 * Once payment is processed successfully, your subscription will be activated immediately.
 * You will gain full access to the selected dashboard features according to your subscription plan.

**3.2. Access Credentials**
 * Login credentials or access details will be provided via email after payment confirmation.

### 
4. No Cancellation or Refund
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/check-out-policy#4-no-cancellation-or-refund)
 * By completing the check-out process, you acknowledge that all sales are final.
 * Due to the nature of our services as immediate-access digital goods and ability for users to download data, no cancellations or refunds will be granted once the subscription is activated.

### 
5. Billing Terms
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/check-out-policy#5-billing-terms)
**5.1. One-Time Purchases**
 * For single-payment plans, you will only be charged at the time of check-out.

**5.2. Recurring Subscriptions**
 * For recurring subscriptions, payments will be automatically charged based on the billing cycle (e.g., monthly, annually).
 * Customers are responsible for managing their subscription settings to avoid unwanted renewals.

**5.3. Failed Payments**
 * If a payment fails for more than 1 day, access to data services will remain suspended until the payment issue is resolved.
 * If a payment failure persists for more than 3 days, your subscription will be automatically canceled, and all access to data services will be terminated.

### 
6. Tax and Fees
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/check-out-policy#6-tax-and-fees)
 * Any applicable taxes or fees will be calculated and displayed during the check-out process.
 * Customers are responsible for paying all taxes and fees associated with their purchase.

### 
7. Check-Out Errors
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/check-out-policy#7-check-out-errors)
If you encounter any issues during the check-out process (e.g., payment errors or incorrect plan selection):
 1. Contact our support team immediately at **bds@birdeye.so**.
 2. Provide your order details and a description of the issue.
 3. We will assist you in resolving the problem, but refunds or cancellations will not be offered for customer errors.

### 
8. Customer Responsibility
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/check-out-policy#8-customer-responsibility)
Before completing the check-out process, customers must:
 * Ensure the accuracy of their personal and payment information.
 * Verify the selected subscription plan.
 * Understand and accept our No Cancellation and No Refund Policy.

### 
9. Support and Assistance
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/check-out-policy#9-support-and-assistance)
For any questions or concerns regarding the check-out process, please contact us:
Email: **bds@birdeye.so**
### 
10. Acknowledgment
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/check-out-policy#10-acknowledgment)
By completing the check-out process, you confirm that:
 1. You Understand the Product Details and Functionality:
 * You have thoroughly reviewed the product‚Äôs features, functionality, and pricing.
 * You are satisfied that the product meets your needs and technical requirements.
 2. You Accept the Terms and Conditions:
 * You fully understand and agree to the No Cancellation and No Refund Policy.
 * You acknowledge that all sales are final and non-refundable.
 3. You Agree to This Check-Out Policy:
 * You consent to abide by this policy and any other applicable terms outlined 
by Birdeye.so and bds.birdeye.so

# Dashboard - Billing History
The Billing History section provides a detailed log of all financial transactions related to your BDS subscription. It helps users track payments, verify completed transactions, and download invoices when needed.

## 
üìã Transaction Table Overview
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dashboard-billing-history#-transaction-table-overview)
The table includes the following columns:
Column | Description 
---|--- 
Item | Describes the transaction type (e.g., subscription_create) 
Amount | Cost of the transaction (e.g., $0.00) 
Date | When the transaction occurred (e.g., Jun 22, 2025) 
Method | Payment method used (e.g., Link) 
Status | Transaction status (e.g., Completed) 
Invoice | Option to download the invoice PDF by clicking the download icon 
## 
‚¨áÔ∏è Downloading an Invoice
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dashboard-billing-history#%EF%B8%8F-downloading-an-invoice)
 * Click the download icon on the far right of any row to retrieve the invoice associated with that transaction.
 * Useful for accounting, reimbursements, or internal documentation.

## 
‚úÖ Best Practices
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dashboard-billing-history#-best-practices)
 * Review billing records monthly to ensure all charges are as expected.
 * Download and archive invoices for financial audits or tax purposes.
 * Verify payment methods and ensure they are up to date to avoid failed transactions.

# Dashboard - Audit Log
The Audit Log section in the BDS (Birdeye Data Services) Dashboard provides a detailed record of all user and system activities associated with your account. It is a vital tool for ensuring operational transparency, tracking user actions, and complying with security policies.
This log is especially useful for system admins, compliance officers, and developers who want to monitor API key usage, configuration changes, login activity, and other sensitive events.

## 
üîç What You‚Äôll See
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dashboard-audit-log#-what-youll-see)
 * **Activity Records** : Logged actions such as API calls, key generation, whitelist/blacklist updates, and login events.
 * **Timestamps** : Each activity includes the date and time it occurred.
 * **User Info** : The initiator of the action (e.g., email or user ID).

## 
üíæ Downloading Logs
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dashboard-audit-log#-downloading-logs)
 * Click the ‚Äú**Download** ‚Äù button (top-right corner) to export logs for backup or review.
 * Logs are downloadable in formats such as .csv or .json (depending on system settings).

## 
üóÇÔ∏è Retention Policy
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dashboard-audit-log#%EF%B8%8F-retention-policy)
 * **Retention Period:** Logs are kept for 1 year.
 * **Recommendation** : Download your logs regularly to ensure you have historical records before they expire.

**Quick Notes**
 * All wallet APIs are currently in beta and support a low rate limit across all packages (limited to 5 requests per second and 75 requests per minute for all wallet products).
 * The LITE/ STARTER package can only access the multiple price API; all other "multiple" APIs are not accessible.
 * All other batch, multi/ multiple APIs are available exclusively for the BUSINESS package and higher.
 * Max Usage Per Month defines the maximum allowable usage for the package each month is 5 times of the included amount. If the auto-renewal for max usage is not activated, the user will be immediately suspended upon reaching the limit. To continue, the user must manually re-subscribe to the current package or upgrade to a higher package. Users can also enable the auto-renewal feature via the dashboard for uninterrupted data usage. This is essential to keep you informed of high usage and prevent unexpected payments.

# Data Coverage
Our platform delivers extensive real-time and historical data across all supported DEX‚ÄìChain pairs. This includes granular price feeds, event tracking to capture market movements as they happen. We monitor liquidity pools for size, inflows, outflows, and compositional changes, giving a clear view of capital shifts in the market. Comprehensive trading volume metrics are available at daily, weekly, and monthly intervals, alongside token-level information such as contract addresses, market capitalization, creation dates, and circulating supply. By combining live blockchain data with historical trend analysis, we enable in-depth market research, strategy development, and performance monitoring for traders, analysts, and institutions.

# CU carry-over policy
Effective from 01-July-2025

CU Carry-Over Policy 
For prepaid plans with a duration of 6 months or longer, unused Compute Units (CUs) from any given month will be carried over and remain available throughout the full subscription term.
The total CU quota is cumulative over the entire prepaid period. 
There is no monthly reset or CU loss if usage is below the monthly allocation within the same subscription cycle.
However, unused CUs will not carry over to a new subscription cycle once the current term ends.
No overage charges apply‚Äîonce the CU quota is fully used or the term ends, the plan will be renewed accordingly.
Example: 
A 12-month prepaid plan with 50M CUs/month provides 600M CUs in total. If only 30M are used in January, the remaining 570M CUs stay available until the plan ends. If 10M remain unused at the end of the 12-month term, they will expire and not carry over to the next cycle.
üîí Carry-over only applies to prepaid plans of 6 months or longer. It does not apply to monthly billing or shorter-term subscriptions.

# üßÆ Dynamic Compute Unit Cost
## 
OHLCV v3 and OHLCV v3 - Pair
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dynamic-cu-cost#ohlcv-v3-and-ohlcv-v3---pair)
The CU (compute unit) cost is dynamic based on the number of candles requested. This is an update from the previous fixed max of 100 candles per request, now supporting up to 5000 candles.
**üí° New CU Tiers**
Candle Count Range | CU Cost 
---|--- 
< 1000 | 60 
1000 - 2000 | 90 
2000 - 5000 | 120 

## 
Recent txs
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dynamic-cu-cost#recent-txs)
The CU (compute unit) cost is dynamic based on the number of transactions returned. This is an update from the previous fixed max of 100 transactions per request, now supporting up to 500 transactions.
**üí° New CU Tiers**
Candle Count Range | CU Cost 
---|--- 
<= 100 | 25 
101 - 300 | 75 
301 - 500 | 125 
‚ÑπÔ∏è Example:
 * Requesting 90 transactions ‚Üí 25 CU
 * Requesting 250 transactions ‚Üí 75 CU
 * Requesting 490 transactions ‚Üí 125 CU

This dynamic model offers flexibility while scaling with data needs. Please ensure your integration handles CU cost estimation accordingly.

# Error Handling
Learn how to effectively handle errors when using Birdeye APIs. Understand the different types of errors that may be encountered, along with detailed explanations of their potential causes. This session provides insights into error response structures and practical tips for troubleshooting and resolving issues seamlessly.
## 
**400 Bad Request:**
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/error-handling#400-bad-request)
 * Message: "Invalid request parameters or payload."
 * Possible Causes: This error occurs when the provided request parameters or payload are invalid, missing, or improperly formatted. Check the API documentation for the correct format and required parameters.
 * Example Response:

JSON
```
{
  "success": false,
  "message": "Invalid request parameters or payload."
}
```

## 
**401 Unauthorized:**
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/error-handling#401-unauthorized)
 * Message: "Unauthorized. Authentication required."
 * Possible Causes: This error arises when the user lacks proper authentication credentials or the provided credentials are incorrect. Ensure that you include valid authentication tokens or credentials in your request headers.
 * Example Response:

JSON
```
jsonCopy code{
  "success": false,
  "message": "Unauthorized. Authentication required."
}
```

## 
**403 Forbidden:**
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/error-handling#403-forbidden)
 * Message: "Access Denied. You don't have permission to access this resource."
 * Possible Causes: This error is returned when the user's account lacks the necessary permissions to access the requested resource. Ensure that your user account has the required access privileges.
 * Example Response:

JSON
```
jsonCopy code{
  "success": false,
  "message": "Access Denied. You don't have permission to access this resource."
}
```

## 
**422 Unprocessable Entity:**
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/error-handling#422-unprocessable-entity)
 * Message: "Invalid data. Please check the provided data and try again."
 * Possible Causes: This error occurs when the provided data is not valid according to the expected format or validation rules. Check the API documentation for details on the required data format.
 * Example Response:

JSON
```
jsonCopy code{
  "success": false,
  "message": "Invalid data. Please check the provided data and try again."
}
```

## 
**429 Too Many Requests:**
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/error-handling#429-too-many-requests)
 * Message: "Too many requests. Please wait and try again later."
 * Possible Causes: This error is triggered when the client exceeds the rate limit for API requests. It's advised to review the API rate limits and ensure that your requests comply with the allowed rate.
 * Example Response:

JSON
```
jsonCopy code{
  "success": false,
  "message": "Too many requests. Please wait and try again later."
}
```

## 
**500 Internal Server Error:**
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/error-handling#500-internal-server-error)
 * Message: "Internal Server Error. Something went wrong on the server."
 * Possible Causes: This error is raised when there is an unexpected issue on the server-side, such as a database error or an unhandled exception. It's typically not caused by the client's actions.
 * Example Response:

JSON
```
jsonCopy code{
  "success": false,
  "message": "Internal Server Error. Something went wrong on the server."
}
```

 * A secure pop-up form or redirect will prompt you to enter:
 * Credit or debit card number
 * Expiration date
 * CVV/security code
 * Billing address (optional depending on setup)
 * Submit the form to securely link your payment method.

üîê Secure Payments

# Dashboard - Packages
The Packages section allows users to view and manage their current BDS (Birdeye Data Services) subscription plan. It includes details on API limits, current billing cycle, payment status, and upcoming invoices. This ensures users can track usage, upgrade plans, and avoid service interruptions.

## 
üîπ Current Package Panel
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dashboard-packages#-current-package-panel)
 * Plan: Shows the name of your current plan (e.g., Standard).
 * Status: Displays whether your package is active.
 * API Usage Limit: Indicates the CU (Compute Unit) limit, such as 30K CUs.
 * Change Option: Click the "Change" button to upgrade or downgrade your plan.

## 
üìÖ Upcoming Invoice Panel
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dashboard-packages#-upcoming-invoice-panel)
 * Payment Method: Shows the selected method for automatic payments.
 * Total Due: Displays the amount to be paid for the upcoming billing period.
 * Billing Period: Shows the time frame covered by the invoice (e.g., Jun 22, 2025 ‚Äì Jul 22, 2025).

## 
üìä Upcoming Invoice Breakdown
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dashboard-packages#-upcoming-invoice-breakdown)
 * Package Cost: Displays the base cost of your subscription plan.
 * Additional API Usages: If you exceed your CU quota, the extra charges will appear here.
 * Total: Sum of all charges (currently $0.00 in your example).

## 
‚úÖ Best Practices
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dashboard-packages#-best-practices)
 * Monitor CU usage to avoid additional charges.
 * Update payment methods regularly to prevent service disruption.
 * Change packages based on your usage needs (scale up/down).
 * Download invoices regularly for accounting or internal audit.

# Dashboard - Security
The Security Dashboard in Birdeye Data Services (BDS) gives you full control over your API access, helping ensure secure and compliant usage. Here, you can generate and manage your authentication keys, define trusted IP addresses via whitelisting, and restrict unwanted access through blacklisting.
Whether you're a solo developer or part of a security-focused enterprise, this section is essential for protecting your data pipeline and managing usage policies effectively.

## 
1Ô∏è‚É£ Authentication Key Management
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dashboard-security#1%EF%B8%8F%E2%83%A3-authentication-key-management)
 * Purpose: These keys are required to authenticate your API requests.
 * Action: Click ‚ÄúGenerate key +‚Äù to create a new API key.
 * We have a small note that shows Total rate limit is set for your account

> Tip: Store your key securely‚Äîtreat it like a password.
## 
2Ô∏è‚É£ Whitelist Configuration
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dashboard-security#2%EF%B8%8F%E2%83%A3-whitelist-configuration)
 * Restrict API access to a predefined list of IP addresses.
 * Click ‚ÄúAdd +‚Äù in the WhiteList section to input allowed IPs.
 * Ideal for environments with static IPs, internal tools, or corporate firewalls.

## 
3Ô∏è‚É£ Blacklist Configuration
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dashboard-security#3%EF%B8%8F%E2%83%A3-blacklist-configuration)
 * Block specific IP addresses from accessing your APIs.
 * Click ‚ÄúAdd +‚Äù in the BlackList section to input banned IPs.
 * Use this to respond to suspicious activity or unauthorized attempts.

## 
‚úÖ Best Practices
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dashboard-security#-best-practices)
 * Rotate authentication keys periodically.
 * Use whitelisting for production environments.
 * Monitor audit logs regularly (available in the Audit Logs section).
 * Never expose your API keys in frontend code or public repositories.

# Dashboard - Metrics
The Metrics Dashboard in Birdeye Data Services (BDS) provides visibility into your API performance and compute unit (CU) consumption. This section is essential for developers, analysts, and operations teams who need to monitor how APIs are being used, detect potential issues, and optimize integration efficiency.
Whether you're tracking live WebSocket activity or historical REST API usage, the Metrics Dashboard enables you to break down key usage patterns by method, status code, and latency.

## 
üîÅ Select API Type
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dashboard-metrics#-select-api-type)
 * Toggle between APIs and WebSocket tabs at the top to choose the data stream you wish to monitor.
 * ‚è± Choose Time Range
 * Use the time filter to adjust your view:
 * 1H ‚Äì Last 1 Hour
 * 1D ‚Äì Last 24 Hours
 * 7D ‚Äì Last 7 Days
 * 30D ‚Äì Last 30 Days

## 
üìà Metrics Overview (Panels Explained)
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dashboard-metrics#-metrics-overview-panels-explained)
 1. **Call Methods Over Time** 
Visualizes the frequency of different API methods (e.g., /price, /pair) over your selected time range.
 2. **CU Usage (Compute Units)** 
Shows compute unit consumption trends, helping you track and optimize costs.
 3. **Call Methods** 
Displays a summary of the API methods being used, sorted by usage frequency.
 4. **Status Code Distribution** 
Breaks down HTTP status codes (e.g., 200, 400, 500) to help you identify failed or errored calls.
 5. **Status Codes Over Time** 
Allows you to monitor the health of your API traffic with a timeline of status code occurrences.
 6. **Response Time** 
Provides an average response time for your API calls‚Äîkey for tracking performance and latency.

## 
‚ö†Ô∏è No Data Displayed?
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/dashboard-metrics#%EF%B8%8F-no-data-displayed)
If you‚Äôre seeing ‚ÄúNo data‚Äù:
 * Confirm that your API calls have been made during the selected time range.
 * Ensure your API keys are correctly configured and in use.
 * Check that the correct data stream (API or WebSocket) is selected.

# Insights
The Insight page serves as a comprehensive hub for assessing the cryptocurrency market. It consolidates a variety of data points‚Äîranging from total market capitalization, total value locked (TVL), and trading volume, to more advanced analytics like market sentiment trends, token screener tools, and visualized token performances. By blending key metrics with intuitive data visualization and analysis features, Insight helps users form a clearer picture of the entire crypto landscape.
# 
Overview of the Key Metrics
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/insights#overview-of-the-key-metrics)
This section helps user navigate and interpret the most important data displayed on the Insight page. Whether you‚Äôre looking for a high-level market overview or diving into specific sectors, these features give you a clear, user-friendly snapshot of the crypto landscape.
## 
1. Market Trend
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/insights#1-market-trend)
### 
Coin 360
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/insights#coin-360)

 * What It Is: A heatmap highlighting the top 100 cryptocurrencies by market cap, presented in an easy-to-scan visual format.
 * Why It Matters: Each token‚Äôs size reflects its market share, and color indicators quickly show price gains or losses‚Äîso you can instantly gauge the overall market sentiment.
 * Data Integrity: Only tokens officially listed on reputable sources (like CoinGecko or CoinMarketCap) are included, helping you avoid spam or low-credibility projects.

### 
Bubble Chart
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/insights#bubble-chart)

 * What It Is: Another visualization of the top 100 tokens by market cap, where each token is represented as a bubble.
 * How It Helps: The bubble size indicates market cap; color or position can show price movements or other metrics. This makes it easy to see which coins dominate the market and how they stack up against one another.
 * Filtering: Just like Coin 360, this chart excludes tokens not recognized by major market data sources.

### 
Native Token Performance
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/insights#native-token-performance)

 * What It Covers: Shows how the main tokens of various blockchains (Layer 1s and Layer 2s) are performing over specific timeframes.
 * Why You Need It: If you‚Äôre comparing, for example, Ethereum vs. BNB Chain vs. newer chains, this section clarifies which ones are gaining or losing momentum in real time.

### 
Crypto Visual Screener
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/insights#crypto-visual-screener)

 * What It Does: Offers an interactive, customizable way to filter and sort tokens based on metrics like trading volume, market cap, and price changes.
 * Why It‚Äôs Useful: Quickly pinpoint tokens experiencing significant price swings, large volume spikes, or any other notable trend‚Äîall in a single, user-friendly interface. This is especially helpful for spotting new opportunities or potential market shifts.

## 
2. Industries
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/insights#2-industries)
### 
Overview of All Sectors
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/insights#overview-of-all-sectors)
 * Sector Heatmap

A color-coded snapshot of how each sector (e.g., DeFi, GameFi, NFTs) is performing, based on aggregated token data.
 * Historical Sector Dominance

How each sector‚Äôs share of total market cap, volume, or TVL has changed over time. This shows you which areas are growing or fading in influence.
 * A metric that summarizes sector performance, making it easy to compare at a glance‚Äîthink of it like a quick score for each sector‚Äôs overall health.
 * Price Performance by Sector: Displays how many tokens in each sector have risen or fallen within a given timeframe, helping you spot sectors on the upswing or in decline.
 * All Sector Stats: An ‚Äúat-a-glance‚Äù table of total market cap, TVL, and trading volume for every sector, along with their 24-hour changes.

# Iframe
# 
Birdeye Iframe Usage Instructions
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/iframe#birdeye-iframe-usage-instructions)
Embedding Birdeye charts into your website or application is a breeze with our versatile iframe feature. Follow these simple instructions to customize and integrate the Birdeye iframe seamlessly:
## 
1 - Choose Your Token
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/iframe#1---choose-your-token)
Use the token BONK (DezXAZ8z7PnrnRJjz3wXBoRgixCa6xjnB7YaB1pPB263) as an example token address.
## 
2 - Configure Iframe UI
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/iframe#2---configure-iframe-ui)
 * Visit our dedicated page to configure your iframe:

```
https://birdeye.so/tv-widget-builder/DezXAZ8z7PnrnRJjz3wXBoRgixCa6xjnB7YaB1pPB263?chain=solana
```

You can access this page from the token page using the embedded icon right above token chart

 * Use the Setting Panel to configure the iframe UI to make it fit to your UI.
 * 
Display price chart of a Pair (Market): If you want to display price chart of a specific pair (market) instead of overall token price chart, you can select the pair in the Token name dropdown, or search by token name, or search by pair address.

## 
4 - Embed the Iframe
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/iframe#4---embed-the-iframe)
Copy and paste the generated URL into the src attribute of an HTML iframe tag on your website or application.
### 
Example HTML:
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/iframe#example-html)
```
<iframe
  width="100%"
  height="600"
  src="https://birdeye.so/tv-widget/DezXAZ8z7PnrnRJjz3wXBoRgixCa6xjnB7YaB1pPB263?chain=solana&viewMode=pair&chartInterval=1D&chartType=CANDLE&chartTimezone=Asia%2FSingapore&chartLeftToolbar=show&theme=dark"
  frameborder="0"
  allowfullscreen
></iframe>
```

## 
5 - Customize and Enjoy
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/iframe#5---customize-and-enjoy)
Feel free to experiment with different chart types, timeframes, and toolbar visibility to tailor the iframe to your specific needs.
Happy charting! üìà‚ú®

# Market Data
Our platform provides comprehensive multi-market data for cryptocurrency tokens, pulling information from both decentralized exchanges (DEX) and centralized exchanges (CEX). This allows users to monitor and analyze token performance across different exchange types in real-time, providing a holistic view of the market landscape.
## 
Supported Decentralized Exchanges
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/market-data#supported-decentralized-exchanges)
Our platform aggregates data from a variety of decentralized exchanges (DEX). This includes information from leading DEXs operating across different blockchain ecosystems.
## 
Supported Centralized Exchanges
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/market-data#supported-centralized-exchanges)
In addition to the decentralized exchanges, our platform also provides real-time multi-market data for cryptocurrency tokens, supporting data from multiple top centralized exchanges (CEX). This allows users to track token prices, volume, and order books across several platforms in one place.
Here is a list of the currently supported centralized exchanges:
No | `Exchange` | `Address` 
---|---|--- 
1 | BINANCE | <https://www.binance.com/en> 
2 | BINANCE US | <https://www.binance.us/> 
3 | COINBASE | <https://www.coinbase.com/> 
4 | TOOBIT | <https://www.toobit.com/en-US> 
5 | GATE | <https://www.gate.io/> 
6 | BYBIT | <https://www.bybit.com/en/> 
7 | OKX | <https://www.okx.com/> 
8 | MEXC | <https://www.mexc.com/> 
9 | BINGX | <https://bingx.com/> 
We are continuously working to expand our list of supported exchanges to enhance market coverage.
#### 
CEX data concepts explanations
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/market-data#cex-data-concepts-explanations)

**Spread (%):** Absolute difference (%) between the best (lowest) ask price and the best (highest) bid price in the order book over average price
**Depth +1%** : refers to the cumulative volume of sell orders (asks) within 1% above the current market average price.
**Depth -1%** refers to the cumulative volume of buy orders (bids) within 1% below the current market average price.

# Overage Charge rule
## 
1. Stripe Users
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/overage-charge-rule#1-stripe-users)
For customers paying via Stripe, the overage charge policy is structured to handle excess usage effectively, ensuring service continuity while aligning charges with usage levels.
### 
Key Points:
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/overage-charge-rule#key-points)
**Billing Cycle** : Overage charges are applied based on specific usage tiers, with higher included CU allowances permitting greater overage thresholds before additional charges are incurred.
**Overage** is a post-paid model that allows users to continue using data after their quota is used up, charged at a low overage cost.
When the overage amount reaches the **Partial Overage Charge** threshold (a predefined amount depending on the specified plan), the system will automatically charge to reset the post-paid allowance.
**Payment Failure Consequences:**
 * Suspended Access: If an overage payment fails, the user's access will be suspended within 1 day. To resume access, the user must settle the overdue payment.
 * Cancellation: If the payment remains unresolved for 3 days, the account will be canceled. After cancellation, the user must purchase a new package to regain access.

#### 
Usage Tiers:
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/overage-charge-rule#usage-tiers)
Overage charges are calculated based on the following incremental tiers:
0‚Äì20 million CUs
20‚Äì50 million CUs
50‚Äì200 million CUs
200‚Äì500 million CUs
500‚Äì1,000 million CUs
1,000‚Äì2,000 million CUs
Above 2,000 million CUs
**Details**
Package | Partial overage charge each 
---|--- 
Lite | $100 
Starter | $100 
Premium | $100 
Business | $300 
This structure ensures fairness and transparency in billing, with charges aligned to usage levels and clear steps for users to restore or renew their service if payments fail.
## 
2. Crypto Users
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/overage-charge-rule#2-crypto-users)
For customers paying via cryptocurrency, overage charges are deducted from their prepaid credit, ensuring a smooth handling of excess usage:
 * **Prepaid System** : Crypto users pay for their package **3 months in advance**.
 * **Overage Deduction** : Overage usage beyond the included CU allowance is **deducted from the prepaid credit**.
 * **Renewal Requirement** : Once the prepaid credit is depleted, the user will be notified and required to **renew their payment** to continue using the service.

### 
Example
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/overage-charge-rule#example)
 * A crypto user with a **3-month prepaid plan** runs out of included CUs after 2 months.
 * The overage charges are deducted from the remaining credit.
 * Once the credit is depleted, the user will be notified and prompted to renew their plan.

This system ensures that crypto users manage overage charges within their prepaid plan, allowing them to continue service smoothly.
* * *
## 
Important Note
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/overage-charge-rule#important-note)
For a more convenient experience, users are encouraged to upgrade to a plan with a higher included usage allowance. This helps reduce the likelihood of overage charges and ensures smoother operations. Additionally, WebSocket data has a **different and separate overage charge**. For more information on WebSocket overage pricing, please contact the Birdeye team.

# Payment
At Birdeye Data Services, we strive to provide flexible payment options to accommodate the diverse needs of our users. Whether you prefer traditional methods or cutting-edge alternatives, we offer convenient payment solutions tailored to your preferences.
# 
Credit Card Payments via Stripe
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/payment#credit-card-payments-via-stripe)
Our primary payment method is via credit cards processed through Stripe, a trusted and secure payment gateway. With Stripe, users can easily make payments using major credit cards, including Visa, Mastercard, American Express, and Discover. Stripe ensures seamless transactions and robust security measures to safeguard your payment information.
# 
Crypto Payments
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/payment#crypto-payments)
For users seeking alternative payment methods, we also accept payments in cryptocurrencies by stablecoin such as USDC, USDT.
> üìò
> ### 
> Crypto payment is only applicable for longer duration subscription
> [](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/payment#crypto-payment-is-only-applicable-for-longer-duration-subscription)
> It's important to note that while we accept crypto payments for all transactions, including one-time purchases and recurring subscriptions, we exclusively offer crypto payment options for subscription plans of longer durations. Specifically, **users can pay for subscription plans spanning 3 months, 6 months, or 1 year using cryptocurrencies**.
# 
How to Make Payments
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/payment#how-to-make-payments)
**Credit Card Payments:** Simply navigate to the payment section of your account dashboard and select the option to pay via credit card. Follow the prompts to securely enter your payment details and complete the transaction.
**Crypto Payments:** To make payments using cryptocurrencies, CONTACT US for detailed instructions.
* * *
# 
Managing Subscriptions
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/payment#managing-subscriptions)
For subscription-based services, users can easily manage their subscription preferences through their account settings. Update your payment method, modify subscription plans, or cancel subscriptions as needed to suit your evolving requirements.
* * *
# 
Contact Us
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/payment#contact-us)
If you have any questions or encounter any issues regarding payment options or subscription management, our dedicated support team is here to assist you. Feel free to reach out to us using the CONTACT DETAILS HERE.
At Birdeye Data Services, we're committed to providing a seamless and hassle-free payment experience, empowering you to access our cutting-edge data solutions with ease and confidence. Thank you for choosing Birdeye Data Services as your trusted data partner.

# API Sample Request/Response
# 
Endpoints
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/premium-apis-1#endpoints)
Click on each API to view detailed instructions
No. | API | Description | Endpoint 
---|---|---|--- 
1 | Token List | Access a list of available DeFi tokens, offering a comprehensive overview of tokens available for analysis. | <https://docs.birdeye.so/reference/get_defi-tokenlist> 
2 | Price | Access real-time price data for tokens (not NFTs), enabling the tracking of market prices across various tokens. | <https://docs.birdeye.so/reference/get_defi-price> 
3 | Price History | Retrieve historical price data for tokens (not NFTs), providing insights into past price movements and trends. | <https://docs.birdeye.so/reference/get_defi-history-price> 
4 | Token Overview | Obtain an overview of a specific DeFi token, including key information such as symbol, name, and other relevant data. | <https://docs.birdeye.so/reference/get_defi-token-overview> 
5 | Token - Security | Get details about security of a token, including its mint time, smart contract status, etc. | <https://docs.birdeye.so/reference/get_defi-token-security> 
6 | Multi Price | Obtain multi-token price data for tokens and pairs, allowing simultaneous retrieval of pricing information. | <https://docs.birdeye.so/reference/get_defi-multi-price> 
7 | Trades - by Token | Fetch trade history for a specific token (not NFTs), providing insights into recent token movements and activities. | <https://docs.birdeye.so/reference/get_defi-txs-token> 
8 | Trades - by Pair | Retrieve trade history for a specific pair/market, offering details about trades and interactions within that pair. | <https://docs.birdeye.so/reference/get_defi-txs-pair> 
9 | OHLCV - by Token | Obtain Open-High-Low-Close-Volume (OHLCV) data for DeFi tokens, presenting historical price movements and trends. | <https://docs.birdeye.so/reference/get_defi-ohlcv> 
10 | OHLCV - by Pair | Get OHLCV data for a specific DeFi token pair/market, offering insights into historical price movements for that pair. | <https://docs.birdeye.so/reference/get_defi-ohlcv-pair> 
11 | OHLCV - by Base/Quote | Fetch OHLCV data for any two tokens, which do not necessarily have common pairs/markets. | <https://docs.birdeye.so/reference/get_defi-ohlcv-base-quote> 
12 | Token - All market list | Detailed information about cryptocurrency markets on blockchain | <https://public-api.birdeye.so/defi/v2/markets> 
14 | Price- Historical Unix | Retrieves the historical price of a specified token at the closest available time to a given Unix timestamp. | <https://public-api.birdeye.so/defi/historical_price_unix> 
15 | Defi - Price Volume (Single) | Retrieves the current price and volume data for a specified token over a given time period. | <https://public-api.birdeye.so/defi/price_volume/single> 
16 | Defi - Price Volume (Multiple) | Retrieves the current price and volume data for multiple specified tokens over a given time period. | <https://public-api.birdeye.so/defi/price_volume/multi> 
17 | Token - New Listing | Get newly listed tokens of any supported chains. | <https://public-api.birdeye.so/defi/v2/tokens/new_listing> 
18 | Token - Top Traders | Get top traders of given token. | <https://public-api.birdeye.so/defi/v2/tokens/top_traders> 
19 | Token - Trending | Retrieve a dynamic and up-to-date list of trending tokens based on specified sorting criteria. | <https://public-api.birdeye.so/defi/token_trending> 
20 | Token - Meta Data (Single) | retrieving detailed metadata about a specific token on a chosen blockchain. | <https://public-api.birdeye.so/defi/v3/token/meta-data/single> 
21 | Token - Meta Data (Multiple) | pull metadata for multiple tokens in a single API call. | <https://public-api.birdeye.so/defi/v3/token/meta-data/multiple>

# SUBSCRIBE_BASE_QUOTE_PRICE
The "SUBSCRIBE_BASE_QUOTE_PRICE" event allows you to receive real-time updates about price changes for any token pairs without needing to input a specific pair address; you can simply pass the two token addresses you want to track. You can subscribe to price updates for these token pairs in the form of OHLCV (Open, High, Low, Close, Volume) data. This subscription is useful for tracking price movements and trends on the Birdeye platform.
## 
Code Example
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/subscribe_base_quote_price#code-example)
Check out this Github file for an example:
<https://github.com/TheNang2710/bds-public/blob/main/ws-base-quote.js>
## 
1. WebSocket URL:
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/subscribe_base_quote_price#1-websocket-url)
```
wss://public-api.birdeye.so/socket/solana?x-api-key=YOUR-API-KEY
```

### 
Header
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/subscribe_base_quote_price#header)
Key | Value 
---|--- 
`Origin` | ws://public-api.birdeye.so 
`Sec-WebSocket-Origin` | ws://public-api.birdeye.so 
`Sec-WebSocket-Protocol` | echo-protocol 
## 
2. Subscribe to Base-Quote Price (OHLCV)
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/subscribe_base_quote_price#2-subscribe-to-base-quote-price-ohlcv)
To receive real-time updates about price changes for a specific token pair in the form of OHLCV data, use the following subscription message format:
### 
Subscription message
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/subscribe_base_quote_price#subscription-message)
json
```
{  
  "type": "SUBSCRIBE_BASE_QUOTE_PRICE",  
  "data": {  
    "baseAddress": "So11111111111111111111111111111111111111112",  
    "quoteAddress": "EPjFWdd5AufqSSqeM2qN1xzybapC8G4wEGGkZwyTDt1v",  
    "chartType": "1m"  
  }  
} 
```

### 
Sample response
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/subscribe_base_quote_price#sample-response)
json
```
{  
  "type": "BASE_QUOTE_PRICE_DATA",  
  "data": {  
    "o": 153.00668789866964,  
    "h": 153.0229060481432,  
    "l": 152.88823226160142,  
    "c": 152.89094335479908,  
    "eventType": "ohlcv",  
    "type": "1m",  
    "unixTime": 1729158060,  
    "v": 0,  
    "baseAddress": "So11111111111111111111111111111111111111112",  
    "quoteAddress": "EPjFWdd5AufqSSqeM2qN1xzybapC8G4wEGGkZwyTDt1v"  
  }  
}
```

### 
Implementation Example in JavaScript
[](https://docs.birdeye.so/docs/subscribe_base_quote_price#implementation-example-in-javascript)
Use the above github js code and run
bash
```
node ws-base-quote.js solana So11111111111111111111111111111111111111112 EPjFWdd5AufqSSqeM2qN1xzybapC8G4wEGGkZwyTDt1v 1m
```

**Explanation:**
 * `solana`: The blockchain chain to subscribe to (e.g., Solana).
 * `So11111111111111111111111111111111111111112`: The base token address.
 * `EPjFWdd5AufqSSqeM2qN1xzybapC8G4wEGGkZwyTDt1v`: The quote token address (e.g., USDC).
 * `1m`: The chart type, which is the interval for OHLCV data (e.g., 1 minute).

**Note:**
 * This example subscribes to real-time price updates for a token pair and logs the Open, High, Low, Close, and Volume data to the console. The subscription is automatically closed after 1 hour.
 * This WebSocket only support 1 base-quote pair for 1 connection. You need to open another connection for new base-quote subscription.

 * Usage Bar: Visual indicator showing progress toward the monthly CU limit (30,000 in this case).
 * Legend: Green dot = CUs used month to date.
